abstract: Chinese banks, flush from record profits that were bolstered by a yearlong lending binge, are expected to face a business slowdown as Beijing tries to slow lending to keep the economy from overheating, Reuters reported.
snippet: Chinese banks, flush from record profits that were bolstered by a yearlong lending binge, are expected to face a business slowdown as Beijing tries to slow lending to keep the economy from overheating, Reuters reported.
lead_paragraph: Chinese banks, flush from record profits that were bolstered by a yearlong lending binge, are expected to face a business slowdown as the government tries to slow lending to keep the economy from overheating, Reuters reported.

headline.main: Record Profit for Chinese Banks Not Likely to Last

abstract: Cosco Pacific, the Chinese ports operator, said it has agreed to acquire a 13.7 percent stake in Sigma Enterprises increasing its stake to 20.55 percent, Finance Asia reported. The deal was valued at $520 million.
snippet: Cosco Pacific, the Chinese ports operator, said it has agreed to acquire a 13.7 percent stake in Sigma Enterprises increasing its stake to 20.55 percent, Finance Asia reported. The deal was valued at $520 million.
lead_paragraph: Chinese ports operator Cosco Pacific said it had agreed to acquire a further 13.7 percent stake in Sigma Enterprises, increasing its stake to 20.55 percent.

headline.main: China Ports Operator Increases Stake in Sigma

abstract: A drug harvested from pigs’ intestines has made a low-profile Chinese couple the nation’s wealthiest overnight, The Financial Times reported.
snippet: A drug harvested from pigs’ intestines has made a low-profile Chinese couple the nation’s wealthiest overnight, The Financial Times reported.
lead_paragraph: A drug harvested from pigs’ intestines has made a low-profile Chinese couple the nation’s wealthiest overnight. Husband and wife Li Li and Li Tan’s Shenzhen Hepalink Pharmaceutical sold 10 percent of its shares this week in an I.P.O. that values their stake at about $6.2 billion, The Financial Times reported.

headline.main: Bringing Home the Bacon: Tripe-Based Drug Hits Gold
